title: Sell Alexander Murray Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Alexander Murray Whisky | Trader Joe's & Costco Rare Releases | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Alexander Murray whisky. We buy the rare 30+ year old single malts released via Costco, Trader Joe's, and Total Wine.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for Alexander Murray 30+ Year Old releases.
introParagraph: Alexander Murray bottles much of the private label whisky for major US retailers like Costco and Trader Joe's. While some are standard, their high-age statements (e.g., Macallan 30, Bunnahabhain 40) are serious assets.
whatWeBuy: Alexander Murray Single Casks (Costco/Total Wine Exclusives)
photoChecklist: Front label showing Age and Distillery
Back label confirming 'Bottled by Alexander Murray'
conditionFactors: Label: Retailer brands (Kirkland) generally trade lower than the Alexander Murray brand itself, even if the liquid is similar.
Wooden Box: The high-end releases come in polished wooden boxes. Essential for value.
pricingFactors: Age: 40, 50, and 53 year old bottlings are the targets.
Distillery: A named Macallan or Glenlivet is worth 10x an 'Undisclosed Speyside'.
Polly's Casks: The Firestone Walker collaboration series is niche but cool.
Monumental Blend: The 30 year blend is a value pick but we buy it.

faqs.question: Do you buy Costco Scotch?
faqs.answer: Yes, if it is the high-age (18-24+ year) single malt series bottled by Alexander Murray.

faqs.question: Is 'Undisclosed Speyside' valuable?
faqs.answer: It depends on the age. A 40-year undisclosed Speyside has value, but less than a named Glenfarclas.

faqs.question: Do you buy Trader Joe's whisky?
faqs.answer: Only the limited high-age releases (e.g. 20+ year Highland). Not the $20 bottles.

faqs.question: Who is Alexander Murray?
faqs.answer: A California-based independent bottler with deep stocks in Scotland.

faqs.question: Do you buy the 'Bon Accord' series?
How do I ship a wooden box?
faqs.answer: Wrap the bottle separately. The box is heavy and can crush the glass neck.
